title: Permanent Bans. Comment your thoughts/ideas and please be sensible about it.
body:
Half a day ago i received a permanent ban on my account for verbal abuse, flaming and a negative attitude. It was of no surprise after a few bans before (including a 2 week ban last month and a few smaller incidents). I'm not really fussed about being banned, it was my stupidity after all that caused it, and yes i am admitting that it was all me. However i'm more worried for the money and time I've spent on that account. If you do the math, I've played around 1500 games (lets say 30 minutes on average each) adding up to around 45 000 minutes or 750 hours in total playing LoL. I've also spent over $150 dollars on LoL i'd say. Perhaps just a bit under. I even spent $20 dollars on the game just before i got banned (how ironic).

It's quite worrying that Riot would ban players after their long-term commitment to become better at the game, and their dedication to paying for visual upgrades like Skins to support Riot in their creations. Yes i do acknowledge that i made stupid decisions leading up to the permanent ban, yes i was warned before hand through smaller bans and yes it was essentially 95% my fault. No one else was to blame. But why the permanent ban Riot? Why permanently ban any player for verbal abuse and so forth, it's not inflicting serious harm (because if it really were other legal authorities would be involved) and it's not damaging the game in any form or matter (because unfortunately in today's gaming world, flaming is quite prevalent  amongst all gaming platforms and games). 

Personally i find it absurd that Riot would permanently ban accounts, without thinking twice, for such minor offences. Every other game that has ever been published to date has and will never permanently ban accounts over such trivial incidents. I have heard of larger incidents such as hacking, scamming and cheating in other games leading to permanent bans and that is completely understandable, but if every game including LoL was to permanently ban accounts over verbal abuse, unfortunately there would be probably only 25% of the gaming community left. 

Please don't think i'm jumping to conclusions either. Don't comment "oh but how come 99.9% of the rest of the LoL community hasn't been permanently banned?", because that's not what i'm getting at. If Riot were actually thorough about these bans, trust me there would only be 25% of the community left. You're basically telling me you've never flamed or sworn in game? Are you really telling me you're an Angel? Be honest with yourself. 

Riot seriously needs to reconsider their banning scheme. Remove permanent bannings almost altogether. Keep if for larger incidents such as the intention to hack, or did hack. Or cheating through programs that help you script in game. Or scamming other players for their RP through gifts. Etc. If they don't want to rework their banning scheme, i suggest they immediately refund each permanently banned account's RP and ship that RP off to another account owned by the same person. Now don't say "oh but why would you want to reward players that caused emotional distress to others through verbal abuse etc?". It's not a reward to have your account revoked from you, with 84 champions that you individually saved up IP for, with all that time spent playing ranked.. trying to get better and learn more and more along the way, not to mention all that time spent leveling up to level 30, all the friends you made on that account, your ranked teams and clubs all gone and so much more. It took time and effort to build that account, so it being revoked would make people  like me reconsider my stupidity and insolence in the Riot community and across other games, refund us the RP to another account and i'm over 100% sure people like me will reform into the community and make it a better place even. We could lead others and be good examples of what not to do as we have had personal experience. I don't understand why we have to be punished unforgivably by Riot, and i understand even less as to why there is no support from Riot surrounding bans in general. It's all automated and fake and they don't take into consideration the actual feelings of the players being banned. LoL this past month has felt like a casino dedicated to making you lose money no matter the costs. I regret supporting them but i really don't want to. Doesn't anybody agree with me?

The solution should be to chat ban accounts for a month on end, remove their rights to type anything of an inappropriate nature. Please don't say something completely bullshit like " oh but if we do that instead, then that'll punish other players due to the lack of communication without typing in game", because that's an easy fix. Just revoke their right to play ranked while they have a chat ban in place. In normal's you don't really need to type that much and Riot's system of being able to type a single word/sentence every couple of minutes during a game is good enough how it is. In-fact its perfect.

> [{quoted}](name=ontheleg,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=E74ersQY,comment-id=,timestamp=2016-04-03T15:30:05.482+0000)
>
> yes it was essentially 95% my fault.

I believe the value you are looking for is "100%"

> it's not inflicting serious harm 

F\*ck this statement, seriously. You have no way of knowing if the other person is seriously affected by what you've done. For all you know that person you flamed the other day could have been contemplating suicide and what you said sent them over the edge. People could be dead because of what you've done so f*ck you for saying this.

I'm not even bothering to read another word because now I just know you more than deserved that ban.

To be perfectly honest, anyone who plays League of Legends while contemplating suicide are just asking to pushed.

People who aren't in the right mindset when they click play are scumbags. Actions speak louder than words, and I have broken more keyboards watching shitlord players making shitlord plays than I have by being abused.

This generation needs to man the fuck up and stop crying over everything.

If you are contemplating suicide, call a hotline, not top lane.

> [{quoted}](name=Mickey Knox,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=E74ersQY,comment-id=00030001,timestamp=2016-04-10T13:50:38.948+0000)
> 
> This generation needs to man the fuck up and stop crying over everything.

The implication being that everyone has control over the way their mind works, which simply isn't the case. People can't just "get over" mental illness in the same way people can't just "walk off" a broken leg, it just doesn't work that way and we shouldn't be saying they shouldn't be doing something because of the few d!ckheads who can't comprehend that.

While I would agree that anyone suffering from mental illness or something of the like certainly needs to be more careful in the way they expose themselves to certain "triggers", I completely and wholeheartedly disagree that "man the f*ck up" is an acceptable way to respond to such individuals.

I must say though, that sometimes other players need a good old 1965 kick to the teeth, not referring specifically to OP, but some players are just asses who need to be told so.

But welcome to 2016, people get aggro and yell at each other, than complain someone is yelling at them, than complain they got punished.

You confuse me broskie, you say that players verbally abusing each other is wrong, and as a resulting punishment they need physical abuse? 

You're a kinky one, son.

> You're basically telling me you've never flamed or sworn in game? Are you really telling me you're an Angel? Be honest with yourself.

Hardly, we aren't all special little angels that are perfect and never get mad. That is about as far from the truth as you can get. I'm a freaking Emissary and I've gotten mad in chat before. I believe the Yi said something to the effect of "don't worry ull learn, I call the shots not you", now that just pissed me right off.

The difference? That was ONE game. I can think of maybe two games where it's gotten the better of me in actual chat (have your frustrations, just don't take them into game to abuse people). I've never received a behaviour alert (though that system has no been removed) and I've never been punished. This is true of the VAST MAJORITY of players.

So you want Riot not to perma ban for consistent verbal abuse because it's "just" abuse? I think you need to take a long hard look at your attitude, and why Riot takes this so seriously.

know what isnt far from the truth though, people who personally aggravate players to get them banned, i would think riot should be doing things about those people. Seriously, there are people getting others banned because they decided to commit a game to pissing that person off, then that person pays not the person who caused it? should be some consequence for that person, ie share the same fate, because of the ass hats they are.
They do trust me on that one. Those people will face punishments for those actions as well.

But unfortunately they don't, as in my case where i had been grieved by the bot lane through constant stealing of buffs, constantly following me around leashing my exp etc. I am certain nothing occurred for them. Whats worse is when you start to flame at them, your team and the enemy team will back them up for their stupid actions and go against you.

If Riot gives refund to another account that you owned when one of your account gets banned. I'm pretty sure I will flame in chat and let my salty self reign free. 

What use for a punishment system when you get a free pass to go on another account with all the skins/rp that you had from the banned account made readily available.  Riot might as well get rid of their tribunal system and let people be  toxic and create a negative gaming environment. 

I know its tough to lose all  of your efforts and money  but a permanent ban is not enforced just by one game or one incident. It is the accumulation of offences that you have done and you may not remember all but Riot does. You should also know that Riot doesn't tolerate toxic behavior at all. Why continue on with your improper behavior? 

I played from NA to EUW server and I got ban once for being a flaming idiot. I learned from my lesson and became a better player and just learn to let it go. And if others do flame you, I don't just start bantering how their decision-making is so bad and wow gg noob missed skillshots. I just report them :) 

I hope you all the best and maybe I'll see you on the rift again better then ever.
korea only 1 account per person, problem solved

They don't just perm ban you, clearly you've done something or multiple things wrong you've admitted to, I guess the perm ban was them trying to get a message across to you that being aggressive/toxic helps no one and will only end in you being punished.

You've had multiple bans because of the same offence to me that means you've learn't fuck all from all of this and that banning you for short periods of times has no effect on you, so one way or another they want people or more likely attitudes like you/yours out of the community.

The fact you're losing your account/money because of your actions is not their fault.

You need to go see a therapist if you think verbal abuse is ok!
Who cares how much spent on the game.  You chose to verbally abuse another human being.  It is well known that disabilities can cause drastic outcomes from verbal abuse even over the Internet.  People have committed suicide due to it.

And the fact that you can say it's not a big deal just goes to show you have not learned a thing from your ban
lol 750 hours and 150 dollars, over my three accounts I've bid farewell to it is easily $4k and probably 5000 hours.

because you can refund rp codes? right...
